data.Name: State Province Code

data.Name: Postal Code

data.Name: Country Code

data.Name: Table Code

data.Description: Coded identification of the table.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Message_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the table.

data.Name: Table Creation Date Time
data.DictionaryEntryName: Message_ List. Table Creation Date Time. Date Time
data.Description: The date and time the table was created.

data.Name: Number of Records in Table
data.DictionaryEntryName: Message_ List. Number of Records in Table. Numeric
data.Description: Number of records in this table. When a table is split over more then one file this is the total of records within the several table files.

data.Name: XML Attributes

data.Name: Creation Date Time
data.DictionaryEntryName: Message_ List. Creation Date Time. Date Time
data.Description: Date and time the file was created.

data.Name: Primary Contact

data.Name: Tax Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax_ List. Tax Type Code. Code
data.Description: The code of Tax type. Shall match the Tax_Type_Code in the BAS_Tax_Type table.

data.Name: Tax Local Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax_ List. Local Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount of Tax  included in the transaction. Recorded in local currency.

data.Name: Tax Transaction Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax_ List. Transaction Amount. Amount
data.Description: The amount of Tax included in the transaction. Recorded in transaction currency.

data.Name: GL Tax Debit Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax_ List. Defined. Debit_ Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The GL account number on which the debit side of the Tax transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: GL Tax Credit Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax_ List. Defined. Credit_ Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The GL account number on which the credit side of the Tax transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: Employee
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. Employee
data.Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to an employee (e.g. loan to corporate officers). The value stored in this field stored is Employee_ID. Shall match the Employee_ID in the BAS_Employee table.

data.Name: Project
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. Project
data.Description: This field is a fixed account segement, recording information related to a project; for example, construction projects which require a separate accounting. The value of this field stored is Project_ID. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table through GL_Account_Segment.

data.Name: Bank Account
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. Bank Account
data.Description: This field is a fixed account segment, recording information related to bank accounts. The value of this field stored is Bank_Account_Number, and we can get more information of a certain bank account in the BAS_Bank_Account table. Shall match the Bank_Account_Number in the BAS_Bank_Account table through GL_Account_Segment.

data.Name: Account Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ Code. Spefified. X_ Account Segment
data.Description: Reserved field that shall be used for supplementary information associated with particular account. The 'X' signifies that each unique account segment will be captured in a separate field.

data.Name: Accounting Period ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Period_ List. ID

data.Name: Fiscal Year
data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Period_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.Description: The fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as YYYY, which is part of the extended format and the YYYY-MM-DD in ISO 8601-1.

data.Name: Accounting Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Period_ List. Accounting Period. Code
data.Description: The accounting period in which the calendar date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date.

data.Name: Accounting Period BEG Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Period_ List. Beginning. Date
data.Description: The calendar beginning date of the current accounting period.

data.Name: Accounting Period Ending Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Accounting Period_ List. Ending. Date
data.Description: The calendar ending date of the current accounting period.

data.Name: Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. ID
data.Description: The number of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center. ISO 13616  is recommended if applicable.

data.Name: Bank Account Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Account Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the account opened in institutions, for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.

data.Name: Bank Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Code. Code
data.Description: The code of the financial institution ((ISO 9362 or ISO 17442). ISO 17442 is preferred. One reason is that bank branch identifier will not change due to location movement.

data.Name: Bank Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The full name of the institution for example, bank, financial institution and settlement center.

data.Name: Branch Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Branch Code. Code
data.Description: The code of the institutionï¿½es branch.

data.Name: Branch Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Branch Name. Text
data.Description: The full name of the institution's branch.

data.Name: Branch Country Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Branch Country. Code
data.Description: The country code where the bank is physically located (ISO 3166-1).

data.Name: Branch Region
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Branch Region. Text
data.Description: Sub-region within country; in the U.S., this would be a state; in Canada it would be a province.

data.Name: Active Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the bank account is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bank Account_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Bill Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bill Type_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of the bill type; for example, using 004 to represent bank draft, 005 to represent promissory note, 006 to represent check.

data.Name: Bill Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bill Type_ List. Bill Type Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the bill type; for example, bank draft, commercial draft, promissory note and check.

data.Name: Active Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Bill Type_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the bill type is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Business Segment Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Business Segment_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of each business segment.

data.Name: Business Segment Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Business Segment_ List. Business Segment Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the business segment.

data.Name: Segment Reference Level
data.DictionaryEntryName: Business Segment_ List. Segment Reference Level. Code
data.Description: The relative level of the segment with 1 being the consolidated level and numbers increasing through lower levels of the organizational chart.

data.Name: Organization Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Business Segment_ List. Organization Type Name. Text
data.Description: Indicate the name of the organization type, for example 'Department' and  'Cost Center'.

data.Name: Parent Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Business Segment Hierarchy_ List. Parent. Business Segment
data.Description: The code of the parent business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment _Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Child Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Business Segment Hierarchy_ List. Child. Business Segment
data.Description: The code of the child business segment. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. ID
data.Description: The GL account number.

data.Name: GL Account Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. GL Account Name. Text
data.Description: The name for the GL account.

data.Name: GL Account Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. GL Account Description. Text
data.Description: The label or description associated with the GL_Account_Number.

data.Name: FS Caption
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. FS Caption. Text
data.Description: The financial statement caption represents a related group of accounts; for example, cash and cash equivalents, accounts payable and cost of sales. The caption can be at the trial balance level.

data.Name: Account Type
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Account Type. Code
data.Description: The type of account; for example, assets, liabilities, equity, revenues and expenses.

data.Name: Account Subtype
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Account Subtype. Code
data.Description: The subtype of the account; for example, current assets are the subtype of assets.

data.Name: Account Hierarchy
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Account Hierarchy. Code
data.Description: The corresponding level for account number in the account hierarchy; for example, using 1 to represent assets, and 2 to represent the account subtype current assets.

data.Name: Balance Debit Or Credit Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Balance_ Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.Description: This field is used to indicate whether the natural balance of the account is a debit or credit balance by indicating 'D' or 'C', where assets and expenses have a natural balance of debit, and liabilities, equity and revenues have a natural balance of credit.

data.Name: Active Flag Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the GL account is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Parent GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Parent. Chart Of Accounts
data.Description: The number of the parent account in an account hierarchy. This is provided to allow more than the predefined levels of the hierarchy in the chart of accounts table.When Parent_GL_Account_Number is the highest level, its value can be set to the default value, for example set to NULL. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Chart Of Accounts_ Accounting Account. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Currency Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Currency_ List. Currency. Code
data.Description: The code of the currency type (ISO 4217, Codes for the representation of currencies).

data.Name: Currency Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Currency_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the currency type in the accounting and/or ERP system.

data.Name: Minor Unit
data.DictionaryEntryName: Currency_ List. Minor Unit. Numeric
data.Description: The unit of recorded value which is a division of the respective unit of currency. Minor unit shows the decimal relationship between such unit and the currency itself (ISO 4217). Number 0 means that there is no minor unit for that currency, whereas number 1, 2, 3, etc. signify a ratio of 10:1, 100:1, 1000:1, etc. respectively.

data.Name: Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Currency_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether Currency_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Customized Account Segment Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Segment_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of customized account segment which audit data needs to be used; this does not include the fixed account segment having been identified; for example, unlike customer, budget information is not included in the base module as an individual table, therefore budget can be identified as a customized segment.

data.Name: Customized Account Segment Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Segment_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The customized account segment name which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget records planned revenue and expenditure.

data.Name: Customized Account Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Segment_ List. Description. Text
data.Description: The customized account segment description which audit data needs to be used; for example, budget can be described as the annual plan of aggregated fiscal revenue and expenditure for a state, which is verified and approved through legal procedures.

data.Name: Customized Account Encoding Rule
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Segment_ List. Encoding Rule. Code
data.Description: The encoding rules of the value of a customized account segment. If the encoding rule has a hierarchy feature, each level is separated by '-'; for example, budget (with 1-digit code, like 1) can be subdivided into financial budget (with 2-digit code, like 01) and construction budget (with 2-digit code, like 05), with the financial budget containing budgeted revenue (with 2-digit code, like 03) and budgeted expenditure (with 2-digit code, like 04), which are the third level segments. In this case, Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2.

data.Name: Hierarchy Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Segment_ List. Hierarchy Flag. indicator
data.Description: Whether the table value has a hierarchy feature or not. '1' means 'yes', '0' means 'no'.

data.Name: Active Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Segment_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Customized Account Value Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Value_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of the customized account segment value. If the Customized_ACC_Encoding_Rule is 1-2-2, the corresponding budget-financial budget-budgeted expenditure is 10104.

data.Name: Customized Account Segment Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Value_ List. Segment Code. Identifier
data.Description: This field is associated with the BAS_Customized_ACC_Segment table. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the AS_Customized_ACC_Segment table.

data.Name: Customized Account Value Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Value_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the account segment value of each file. EXAMPLE budget,  financial budget,  budgeted expenditure.

data.Name: Account Value Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Value_ List. Description. Text
data.Description: The detailed description of the account segment value.

data.Name: Parent Account Value Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Value_ List. Parent. Customized Account Value
data.Description: The code of the parent customized account segment value. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Value_Code in BAS_Customized_ACC_Value table.

data.Name: Customized Account Value Hierarchy
data.DictionaryEntryName: Customized Account Value_ List. Customized Account Value Hierarchy. Code
data.Description: The level of the current value in the file structure. For example,  '1' means 'the highest'.

data.Name: Employee ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for an employee. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.Name: Employee Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Code. Text
data.Description: The code of the employee. Each employee has only one code. If someone does part-time jobs in multiple departments, there will be more than one record with different Employee_ID in this table. And the part time status will be reflected in Employee_Type_Code.

data.Name: Employee Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the employee.

data.Name: Inactive Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Inactive Flag. indicator
data.Description: Indicate whether one employee is active or inactive. One employee may become inactive due to some reasons such as sabbatical.

data.Name: Employee Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Type Code. Text
data.Description: The code of the employee types. For example, using 004 to represent an on-the job employee, 005 to represent a retired employee, 006 to represent a deceased employee, 007 to represent a part time employee.

data.Name: Employee Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Type Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the employee type. For example, employed, retired, probation and part-time.

data.Name: Department Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Department Code. Department Code_ Business Segment
data.Description: The code of department rosters. For example, the IT department is designated as code 0018. The code shall match the Business_Segment_code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Employee Job Title
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Job Title. Text
data.Description: The job title of the person in an accounting unit. For example, accounting manager.

data.Name: Employee Academic Degree
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Academic Degree. Text
data.Description: The highest academic degree acquired; for example Doctor, Master.

data.Name: Employment Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Employment Date. Date
data.Description: The employment date of the employee.

data.Name: Termination Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Termination Date. Date
data.Description: The termination date of the employee from which the labor contract was no longer valid, or the employee no longer works in this department.

data.Name: User ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Employee_ Person. Defined. System User
data.Description: The system user ID associated with the employee. The ID shall match the User_ID in the BAS_User table.

data.Name: Journal Entry Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Journal Entry Type_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of the journal entry type; for example, using 004 to represent a cash receipt entry, 005 to represent a cash disbursement entry, 006 to represent a non-cash entry.

data.Name: JE Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Journal Entry Type_ List. Type Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the journal entry type. This is usually categorized by business to satisfy an internal control need and/or to facilitate sorting and querying; for example, journal entries could be classified based on whether the transaction involves cash. In this case there may be cash receipt entry, cash disbursement entry, and non-cash entry of adjusting that is the recording of interest revenue earned and wages payable, estimation that is the recording depreciation, and bad-debt expenses, and/or correction that makes entries to counteract the effects of errors found in the general ledger.

data.Name: JE Type Abbreviation
data.DictionaryEntryName: Journal Entry Type_ List. Abbreviation. Text
data.Description: The abbreviation of the journal entry type.

data.Name: Active Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Journal Entry Type_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the JE type is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: UOM Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Measurement Unit_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of the measurement unit.

data.Name: UOM Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Measurement Unit_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the measurement unit for measuring the quantity of the material.

data.Name: UOM Abbreviation
data.DictionaryEntryName: Measurement Unit_ List. Abbreviation. Text
data.Description: The abbreviation of the measurement unit's name; for example, kilogram is recorded as 'kg' and square meter is recorded as 'sq.m'.

data.Name: Active Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Measurement Unit_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the UOM_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Payment Term Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Payment Term_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of the payment term; for example, terms of 2/10, net 60 could be quoted. This means that customers have 60 days from the invoice date to pay the full amount. However, if payment is made within 10 days, a 2 percent cash discount can be taken.

data.Name: Payment Term Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Payment Term_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The full name of the payment term.

data.Name: Payment Term Line Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Payment Term_ List. Line Number. Text
data.Description: The number of the lines according to the Payment_Term_Code value. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.

data.Name: Payment Term Line Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: Payment Term_ List. Description. Text
data.Description: The detailed description of the payment termï¿½es line; for example, payment due date, discount days, discount percentage.

data.Name: Active Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Payment Term_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the payment term is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Profile Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. ID
data.Description: The number of the current data collection. This number is either generated by manual input or generated by the system.

data.Name: Profile Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the current data collection.

data.Name: Fiscal Year
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.Description: The fiscal year in which the calendar date occurs. The date shall be shown as 'YYYY-MM-DD' in the extended format and the YYYY indicates a fourdigit year (ISO 8601-1).

data.Name: Accounting Entity
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Accounting Entity. Text
data.Description: The legal name of accounting entity.

data.Name: Industry
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Industry. Text
data.Description: The corresponding industry name under superior sector code.

data.Name: Developer Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Developer Name. Text
data.Description: The name of accounting and/or ERP system software developer.

data.Name: Software Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Software Name. Text
data.Description: The name of accounting and/or ERP system software products.

data.Name: Software Version
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Software Version. Text
data.Description: The accounting and/or ERP system software version.

data.Name: Functional Currency Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Functional_ Currency Code. Code
data.Description: The functional or group currency used in accounting and/or ERP system software (ISO 4217).

data.Name: Standard Version
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Standard Version. Text
data.Description: The standard issuing No. of the standards with which the current output files are consistent; for example, ISO 21378.

data.Name: Extracted Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Extracted. Date
data.Description: The date of data extraction.

data.Name: Time Zone
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Time Zone. Code
data.Description: The Time_Zone indicates the difference between local time and UTC of day. The representation of the difference can be expressed in hours and minutes, or hours only. The Time_Zone shall be shown as 'ï¿½}hh:mm in the extended format (ISO 8601-1). EXAMPLE Newfoundlandï¿½fs time zone =-03:30, Beijingï¿½fs time zone=+08:00.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Profile_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Project ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Project_ List. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.Name: Project Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Project_ List. Code. Text
data.Description: The code of each project.

data.Name: Project Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Project_ List. Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the project related to operation and administration.

data.Name: Project Beginning Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Project_ List. Beginning Date. Date
data.Description: The beginning date of the project.

data.Name: Project Ending Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Project_ List. Ending Date. Date
data.Description: The ending date of the project.

data.Name: Active Flag Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Project_ List. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the project is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Project_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Settlement Method Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Settlement Method_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of the settlement method. Various methods can be used to settle transactions and transfer money; for example,  001 for cash, 002 for bills, 003 for credit card, 004 for remittance, and 005 for bank collection.

data.Name: Settlement Method Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Settlement Method_ List. Name. Text

data.Name: Supplier Group

data.Name: Terms Discount Percentage
data.DictionaryEntryName: Supplier_ Party. Terms Discount Percentage. Percentage
data.Description: The discount percentage the supplier can provide if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days. In the flat file, terms are represented as integers to decimal place; for example, 10% would be represented as 0.10.

data.Name: Terms Discount Days

data.Name: Terms Due Days

data.Description: The number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.

data.Name: Supplier Type ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Supplier Type_ List. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for the supplier type. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.Name: Supplier Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Supplier Type_ List. Supplier Type Code. Code
data.Description: The code of the supplier type; for example, using 004 to represent preferred suppliers, 005 to represent key suppliers, 006 to represent common suppliers.

data.Name: Supplier Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Supplier Type_ List. Supplier Type Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the type categorized by the supplier attributes; for example, preferred supplier, key supplier and common supplier.

data.Name: Parent Supplier Type ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Supplier Type_ List. Parent Supplier Type ID. Identifier

data.Name: Regulator Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Code. Code
data.Description: The code of the regulator or jurisdiction.

data.Name: Regulator Country Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Country Code. Code
data.Description: The country code where the regulator is located (ISO 3166-1).

data.Name: Regulator Region
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Region. Quantity
data.Description: The sub-region within country; For example, in the U.S., this would be state and in Canada it would be province.

data.Name: Regulator Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the regulator for which tax is withheld or accrued.

data.Name: Regulator Role
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Role. Text
data.Description: The role of the regulator: federal, regional or local.

data.Name: Regulator Payable Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Payable_ Account Nmber. Chart of Account
data.Description: The GL account used to reflect amounts payable to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table. GL_Account_Name.

data.Name: Regulator Accrual Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Accrual_ Account Nmber.
data.Description: The GL account used to reflect accruals due to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: Regulator Expense Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Expense_ Account Nmber.
data.Description: The GL account used to reflect expense related to the regulator. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: Regulator ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator ID. Identifier
data.Description: The ID assigned / generated by the regulator for the reporting organization to the regulator.

data.Name: Regulator Reporting Organization
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Regulator Reporting ORG. Identifier
data.Description: The code of the reporting organization. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Active Flag
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Active Flag. indicator
data.Description: This indicates whether the Regulator_Code is active or inactive; for example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Regulatory_ Party. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Tax Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Type_ List. Tax Type Code. Code
data.Description: A code used to refer to this tax type, used as a key or cross-reference in files; for example, using 004 to represent the income tax, 005 to represent the tariff, 006 to represent the value added tax.

data.Name: Tax Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Type_ List. Tax Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the tax type; for example, income tax, tariff and value added tax.

data.Name: Regulator Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Type_ List. Regulator Code. Code
data.Description: The code of the regulator for this tax. Shall match the Regulator_Code in the BAS_Tax_Regulatory table.

data.Name: Tax Type Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Type_ List. Tax Type Description. Text
data.Description: The description of the tax type.

data.Name: Tax Code Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Type_ List. Tax Code Description. Text
data.Description: The description of the tax code, subdivision of the tax type; for example, lower percentage applicable for common goods.

data.Name: Tax Percentage
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Type_ List. Tax Percentage. Percentage
data.Description: Default percentage for this combination of tax type and tax code. Can as of the Extracted_Date from Profile table.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Tax Type_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: User ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: User_ Person. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for the individuals entering transactions into the accounting and/or ERP system. Typically auto-generated by the system. This field is used to join information in this table to other tables based on the fields Created_User_ID, Last_Modified_User_ID, Approved_User_ID and Posted_User_ID, respectively.

data.Name: Department Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: User_ Person. Specified. Department_ Business Segment
data.Description: The code of department rosters of the use. For example, the department name is IT department and the code is 0018. Shall match the Business_Segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: User Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: User_ Person. User Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the user.

data.Name: User Job Title
data.DictionaryEntryName: User_ Person. User Job Title. Text
data.Description: The job title of the person in the system; for example, system manager.

data.Name: User Role Responsibility
data.DictionaryEntryName: User_ Person. User Role Responsibility. Text
data.Description: Free form description of the individual's functional role or primary responsibility. For example, responsibility related to managing the information of accounts payable in the system.

data.Name: User Status Modified Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: User_ Person. User Status Modified. Date
data.Description: The modified date of the user's activation or termination status.

data.Name: User Active Status
data.DictionaryEntryName: User_ Person. Active Status. indicator
data.Description: Indicates whether the status of the user is active or inactive. A user may become inactive due to retirement, dismissal or termination etc. For example, 1 is active and 0 is inactive.

data.Name: GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. GL_ Account Number. Code
data.Description: The GL account number. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: Fiscal Year
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.Description: Fiscal year in which the Effective_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYYMM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Accounting Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Accounting Period. Code
data.Description: Accounting period in which the financial statement occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Debit Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Debit Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity information associated with debiting inventory and PPE.

data.Name: Credit Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Credit Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity information associated with crediting inventory and PPE.

data.Name: Beginning Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Beginning Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The beginning quantity of inventory or PPE account.

data.Name: Ending Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Ending Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The ending quantity of inventory or PPE account.

data.Name: UOM Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. . (Component of Quantity)
data.Description: The code of the physical measurement scale for inventory and PPE. Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.Name: Beginning Balance Indicator
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Beginning_ Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.Description: The beginning balance direction for the account. Indicates whether beginning balance is debit or credit. For example, C=credit; D=debit.

data.Name: Ending Balance Indicator
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Ending_ Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.Description: The ending balance direction for the account. Indicates whether ending balance is debit or credit. For example, C=credit; D=debit.

data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. has a. Ending_ Multi Currency Amount

data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. has a. Account Segment

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Period Balance_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ List. ID
data.Description: The GL account number. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the

data.Name: Account Segment Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ List. Account Segment Number. Text
data.Description: The number of the Account_Segment. Case 1 If the value of this field is 0, the record is used to explain a fixed account segment that is distinguished by Account_Segment_Name of the record. Case 2 If the value of this field is 5, the record is used to explain the No.5 field of Account_Segment_X, named Account_Segment_5 in the tables, such as GL_Details.  This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

data.Name: Account Segment Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ List. Account Segment Name. Identifier
data.Description: The name of the Account_Segment.

data.Name: Corresponding File
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ List. Corresponding File. Text
data.Description: The table corresponding to account segment.

data.Name: Account Segment Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ List. Description. Text
data.Description: The detailed description of the Account_Segment_Name.

data.Name: Customized Account Segment Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Segment_ List. Customized Account Segment Code. Identifier
data.Description: The code of the customized account segment. Shall match the Customized_ACC_Segment_Code in the BAS_ Customized_ACC_Segment table.

data.Name: Journal ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for each journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.Name: Journal Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Number. Identifier
data.Description: The number of the journal entry; for example, including serial number, document type, and date.

data.Name: GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Specified. Chart Of Account
data.Description: The GL account number. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the

data.Name: Fiscal Year
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Fiscal Year. Code
data.Description: Fiscal year in which the Effective_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Accounting Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Accounting Period. Code
data.Description: Accounting period in which the Effective_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1 -Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Effective Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Effective. Date
data.Description: The date of the journal entry, no matter when the entry is received or entered. This sometimes refers to the accounting date or accounting effective date; for example, if the user wants to see the financial results for the period ending March 5, 20X1, the journal entry may be created on any day during the open period and be assigned to the period ending March 5, 20X1.

data.Name: Journal Line Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Line Number. Text
data.Description: The number of each line within a journal entry. This number is either generated by manual input or by the system.

data.Name: Journal Entry Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Type Code. Identifier
data.Description: The code of journal entry type. Shall match the JE_Type_Code in the BAS_Journal_Entry_Type table.

data.Name: Journal Entry Header Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Header Description. Text
data.Description: Description of the entire journal entry as described by the journal entry header.

data.Name: JE Line Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Line Description. Text
data.Description: Description of the individual line within the journal entry.

data.Name: Source Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Source Code. Identifier
data.Description: Code for source from which the journal entry originated; for example, sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry, or spreadsheet. Shall match the Source_Code in the GL_Source table.

data.Name: Bill Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Bill Number. Text
data.Description: The number of the bill. A bill usually includes bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. A bill may be issued by the drawer who agreed upon themselves or entrust the drawee at sight; a specified date to the payee or bearer unconditionally pays a certain amount of securities. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system.

data.Name: Bill Type Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Bill Type Code. Identifier
data.Description: The type of the bill; for example, bank drafts, promissory notes and checks. Shall match the Bill_Type_Code in the BAS_Bill_Type table.

data.Name: Bill Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Bill Date. Date
data.Description: The date of the bill.

data.Name: Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity of items referenced in the journal entry line. When the GL_Account_Number is for  inventories or fixed assets, this field is effective, if not, this field is NULL.

data.Name: Measurement Unit Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Measurement Unit Code. Code
data.Description: The code of the physical measurement scale for inventory and PPE referred to as a unit of measurement (UOM). Shall match the UOM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.Name: Unit Price
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Unit Price. Amount
data.Description: The per unit price of the inventory or PPE. This field is associated with Quantity and Amount; for example, if the account is inventory or PPE, we can multiply Quantity by Unit_Price to get total line Amount.

data.Name: Transaction Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Transaction Amount. Amount

data.Name: Settlement Method Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Settlement Method Code. Identifier
data.Description: The code value or indicator of the settlement method used for cash receipt from customers (i.e. sales) and cash payment to suppliers (i.e. purchase); for example, check, wire transfer and cash. Shall match the Settlement_Method_Code in the BAS_Settlement_Method table.

data.Name: Credit Debit Indicator
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Credit Debit Indicator. Code
data.Description: Indicates whether the amount is a credit or debit. 'C' = credit; 'D' = debit.

data.Name: Reversal Indicator
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Reversal Indicator. Code
data.Description: Indicates whether this entry is a reversal or to be reversed. '1' = entry is a reversal, '2' = entry is being reversed, and empty ('') = none of the above or system generated indicators.

data.Name: Reversal Journal ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Reversal. Chart Of Account
data.Description: When the Reversal Indicator Code = 1, this identifies the Journal_ID of the entry being reversed.

data.Name: Cancellation Sign
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Cancellation Sign. indicator
data.Description: The sign of cancellation of a journal entry already formed but not yet posted. For example,  0=entry is not cancelled,  1=entry is cancelled.

data.Name: Created
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. was. Created_ Handling

data.Name: Approved
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. was. Approved_ Handling

data.Name: Posted
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. was. Posted_ Handling

data.Name: Account Segment
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. has a. Account Segment

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Details_ List. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Source Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Source_ List. ID
data.Description: The code of the posting source (code for source from which the journal entry originated; for example, sales journal, cash receipts journal, general journal, payroll journal, accountant manual entry and spreadsheet). The code shall be a unique indicator for the underlying source.

data.Name: Source Description
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Source_ List. Source Description. Text
data.Description: A description of the source system.

data.Name: ERP Subledger Module
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Source_ List. ERP Subledger Module. Text
data.Description: Description of the subledger or ERP module from where the journal entry originated. Should tie back to a system or significant accounting process. In some instances, can be represented by the source system.

data.Name: System Manual Identifier
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Source_ List. System Manual Identifier. Identifier
data.Description: This indicates whether the journal entry is system-generated (S) or manually-entered (M). EXAMPLE S is system-generated and M is manually-entered.

data.Name: Business Process Major
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Source_ List. Business Process Major. Text
data.Description: The major class of transaction associated with a business process; for example, sales.

data.Name: Business Process Minor
data.DictionaryEntryName: GL Source_ List. Business Process Minor. Text
data.Description: A sub-process of the major business process; for example, orders, returns, discounts, etc.

data.Name: GL Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Trial Balance_ List. GL_ Account Number. Code
data.Description: The GL account number. The number is often generated by the system. Shall match the GL_Account_Number used in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: Fiscal Year
data.DictionaryEntryName: Trial Balance_ List. Fiscal Year. Year_ Identifier
data.Description: Fiscal year in which the Balance_As_Of_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Accounting Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: Trial Balance_ List. Accounting Period. Period_ Identifier
data.Description: Accounting period in which the Balance_As_Of_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Balance As Of Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Trial Balance_ List. Balance As Of. Date
data.Description: The date through which the provided balance reflects account activity; for example, if a report was run for activity through 2014-12-31 on 2015-01-22. The date recorded would be 2014-12-31.

data.Name: Balance Begining Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: Trial Balance_ List. has a. Beginning_ Multi Currency Amount

data.Name: Balance Ending Amount
data.DictionaryEntryName: Trial Balance_ List. has a. Ending_ Multi Currency Amount

data.Name: Currency Info

data.Name: Requisition ID

data.Description: The unique identifier for the material purchase requisition. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.Name: Requisition Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition_ Transaction. Requisition Number. Text
data.Description: The number of the material purchase requisition. This number is generated either by manual input or generated by the system.

data.Name: Requisition Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition_ Transaction. Requisition. Date
data.Description: The submission date of the purchase requisition.

data.Name: Status
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition_ Transaction. Status. Code
data.Description: The status of the purchase requisition recorded at the moment. Different ERP vendors have different content for this information output; for example, new, save, submit, approved and frozen.

data.Name: Remark
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition_ Transaction. Remark. Text
data.Description: Freeform text description.

data.Name: Business Segment X
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition_ Transaction. Defned. X_ Business Segment
data.Description: A reserved field that shall be used for business segments / structures. The 'X' signifies an organizational level. Each number used to replace the 'X' is associated with each unique reference level. For example, division, department, business unit, purchasing organization, project or legal entity.

data.Name: Requisition ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Requisition ID.
data.Description: The unique identifier for the material purchase requisition. Typically autogenerated by the system. Shall match the Requisition_ID in the PUR_Requisitions table.

data.Name: Requisition Line ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. ID
data.Description: The unique identifier for a material purchase requisition line. Typically auto-generated by the system. A requisition form may apply for purchasing one or more materials. Each material requisitioned should be described in a seperate row.

data.Name: Requisition Line Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Requisition Line Number. Text
data.Description: The number of a requisition line. The number is generated by manual input or is system generated.

data.Name: Product ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Product ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for the product. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Inventory_Product_ID in the INV_Product table.

data.Name: Requisition Due Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Requisition Due. Date
data.Description: The last requested delivery of the purchased materials in the purchasing requisition. Completion of the delivery shall not be later than that date.

data.Name: Requisition Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Requisition_ Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity in the requisition for material purchased.The quantity of the purchased materials in the requisition.

data.Name: Approved Quantity
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Approved_ Quantity. Quantity
data.Description: The quantity of the material purchase approved.The approved quantity of the purchased materials from the requisition quantity. The approved quantity can differ from the requistion quantity.

data.Name: Purchase UOM Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. . (Component of Quantity)
data.Description: The code of the measurement unit for purchasing materials. Shall match the OM_Code in the BAS_Measurement_Unit table.

data.Name: Project ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Project ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for the project. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Project_ID in the BAS_Project table.

data.Name: Supplier Account ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Supplier Account ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for the supplier account in the purchase requisition. Typically auto-generated by the system. May be set to NULL if no transaction related purchase requisition. Shall match the Supplier_Account_ID in the BAS_Supplier table.

data.Name: Purchase Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Purchase Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the purchase organization which signed the requisition. Shall match the Business_segment_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Requisition Organization Code
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Requisition Organization Code. Identifier
data.Description: The unique code of the organization with material purchase request. The requisition organization is a business organization, or an administrative organization. Shall match the Unique_Bus_Seg_Code in the BAS_Business_Segment table.

data.Name: Status
data.DictionaryEntryName: Purchase Requisition Details_ Transaction Line. Status. Code
data.Description: The status of a requisition line; for example, in process or rejected.

data.Name: Adjustment ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Adjustment ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for the adjustment of record. Typically auto-generated by the system.

data.Name: Adjustment Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Adjustment Number. Text
data.Description: The number of the adjustment of record. This number is generated either by manual input or by the system. This number can be created by concatenating fields to uniquely identify each transaction. For example; serial number, document type, and adjustment date.

data.Name: Adjustment Type Name
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Adjustment Type Name. Text
data.Description: The name of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the customer; for example, credit memo, debit memo, finance charge and other adjustments.

data.Name: Adjustment Document Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Adjustment Document Number. Text
data.Description: The number of an internally generated adjustment document; for example, credit memo. for example, document number, document type, and year. The number is usually generated by manual input or is system generated;

data.Name: Invoice ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Invoice ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for each invoice, from which AR is derived. Typically auto-generated by the system. This field represents the invoice against which the adjustment is applied, if relevant. May be set to NULL if adjustment is at customer (not invoice) level. Otherwise shall match the Invoice_ID in the SAL_Invoices_Generated table.

data.Name: Journal ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Journal ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for journal entry. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Journal_ID in the GL_Details table.

data.Name: Fiscal Year
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Fiscal Year. Year_ Identifier
data.Description: Fiscal year in which the Adjustment_Date occurs. The year shall be shown in four digits as 'YYYY', which is part of the extended format and the 'YYYY-MM-DD' in ISO 8601-1. Shall match the Fiscal_Year in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Accounting Period
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Accounting Period. Period_ Identifier
data.Description: Accounting period in which the Adjustment_Date occurs. Examples include W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods, and from any beginning date to any ending date. Shall match the Accounting_Period in the BAS_Accounting_Period table.

data.Name: Adjustment Date
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Adjustment_ Date. Date
data.Description: The date of the adjustment, regardless of the date the adjustment is entered.

data.Name: Customer Account ID
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Customer Account ID. Identifier
data.Description: The unique identifier for the customer from whom payment is expected or to whom unused credits have been applied. Typically auto-generated by the system. Shall match the Customer_Account_ID in the BAS_Customer table.

data.Name: GL Debit Account Number
data.DictionaryEntryName: Account Receivable Adjustment_ Transaction. Defined.
data.Description: The GL account number on which the debit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

data.Name: GL Credit Account Number

data.Description: The GL account number on which the credit side of the transaction has been posted. Shall match the GL_Account_Number in the BAS_Chart_Of_Accounts table.

A = top 20% representing 80% of risk; B =30%, representing 15% of risk; C =50% of items representing only 5% of the risk.
